main.name: Doro Wat
main.description: Spicy Ethiopian chicken stew simmered in berbere sauce, served with Injera.

main.name: Shiro
main.description: A thick stew made from ground chickpeas and spices, often served with Injera.

main.name: Kitfo
main.description: Minced beef seasoned with Ethiopian butter and spices, traditionally served raw or rare.

main.name: Zigni
main.description: A rich and spicy Eritrean beef stew, slow-cooked in berbere sauce.

main.name: Tibs
main.description: Sautéed beef or lamb cubes with onions, tomatoes, and peppers, served with Injera.

main.name: Gomen
main.description: Collard greens sautéed with garlic and spices, often served alongside meat dishes.

main.name: Firfir
main.description: Spicy and flavorful Injera pieces mixed with berbere sauce and butter.

main.name: Atakilt Wat
main.description: Stew made from cabbage, carrots, and potatoes, seasoned with turmeric and spices.

main.name: Chechebsa
main.description: Fried flatbread pieces mixed with spiced butter and berbere, a favorite breakfast dish.

main.name: Dulet
main.description: A savory dish made from minced tripe, liver, and beef or lamb, mixed with Ethiopian spices.

main.name: Kuanta Firfir
main.description: Dried, spiced beef strips (kuanta) mixed with Injera and berbere sauce.

main.name: Shekla Tibs
main.description: Sautéed beef or lamb cooked with onions, tomatoes, and spices, served sizzling in a hot clay pot.
